properties.media:imagetext:
16
MILLS FIELD
OBSTRUCTION LIGHTS: Each power and telegraph pole in the Airport
vicinity is surmounted by an obstruction light having 50 watt lights with
red globes.
ROADWAY LIGHTS: There are six 100 watt roadway lamps controlled from
a 30 ampere, 2 pole, 250 volt enclosed fused switch set on the meter board,
and connected to the 110 volt lighting service. The circuit consists of two
No. 10 B. & S. gage wires, rubber insulated, N. E. C. Standard, with 3/32
in. lead sheath.
Cable is laid in a trench, not less than one foot in depth.
Vertical runs are enclosed in galvanized rigid conduit.
PUMP HOUSE
BUILDING constructed of 3/16 in. sectional demountable galvanized steel
frame with two doors on entrance side.
MAJOR FLOOR PLAN: 8 ft. x 16 ft.
EQUIPMENT:
One 16 in. Byron Jackson Vertical Screw Pump with bronze impeller,
diffusion, and extra heavy discharge column, together with coupling
and motor barrel machined for:
One 25 h. p. General Electric 690 r. p. m., 220 volt Vertical Motor com-
plete with:
One General Electric CR-7051 Starting Compensator arranged for both
float switch and manual control and affording overload protection.
One G. E. float switch CR-2931-L with chain and float.
One Polyphase watt hour Meter, G. E. type D-7.
One Transformer, Western Transformer Co., type B, phase 1, 60 cycles.
Two Safety Switches, Meyers Safety Switch Company, 200 amperes, 250
volts.
One Enclosed Switch, Brown and Pengilly No. P-2 of 30 amps. and 125
volts.
One Watthour Meter, Westinghouse Type O. B.
One 18 in. pump line with provision for a cast iron flap valve.
PERFORMANCE OF PUMP:
5500 gallons, 11.5 head, 69% efficient, 23 h. p.
SAN FRANCISCO AIRPORT
OPERATION
PERSONNEL
1 Airport Superintendent.
1 Assistant Airport Superintendent.
1 Meteorologist.
1 Flight Surgeon (part time).
1 Policeman.
1 Fire Marshal.
1 Computer (Meteorologist).
1 Airport Aircraft Inspector.
7 Aircraft Mechanics.
1 Gardener.

millsfield:images_texts:
MILLS FIELD
MUNICIPAL AIRPORT
OF SAN FRANCISCO
January, 1929

16
MILLS FIELD
OBSTRUCTION LIGHTS: Each power and telegraph pole in the Airport
vicinity is surmounted by an obstruction light having 50 watt lights with
red globes.
ROADWAY LIGHTS: There are six 100 watt roadway lamps controlled from
a 30 ampere, 2 pole, 250 volt enclosed fused switch set on the meter board,
and connected to the 110 volt lighting service. The circuit consists of two
No. 10 B. & S. gage wires, rubber insulated, N. E. C. Standard, with 3/32
in. lead sheath.
Cable is laid in a trench, not less than one foot in depth.
Vertical runs are enclosed in galvanized rigid conduit.
PUMP HOUSE
BUILDING constructed of 3/16 in. sectional demountable galvanized steel
frame with two doors on entrance side.
MAJOR FLOOR PLAN: 8 ft. x 16 ft.
EQUIPMENT:
One 16 in. Byron Jackson Vertical Screw Pump with bronze impeller,
diffusion, and extra heavy discharge column, together with coupling
and motor barrel machined for:
One 25 h. p. General Electric 690 r. p. m., 220 volt Vertical Motor com-
plete with:
One General Electric CR-7051 Starting Compensator arranged for both
float switch and manual control and affording overload protection.
One G. E. float switch CR-2931-L with chain and float.
One Polyphase watt hour Meter, G. E. type D-7.
One Transformer, Western Transformer Co., type B, phase 1, 60 cycles.
Two Safety Switches, Meyers Safety Switch Company, 200 amperes, 250
volts.
One Enclosed Switch, Brown and Pengilly No. P-2 of 30 amps. and 125
volts.
One Watthour Meter, Westinghouse Type O. B.
One 18 in. pump line with provision for a cast iron flap valve.
PERFORMANCE OF PUMP:
5500 gallons, 11.5 head, 69% efficient, 23 h. p.

Airplanes with folding wings are charged at the rate of floor area occupied
when in folded condition.
SAN FRANCISCO AIRPORT
19
Field rental is $15.00 per month; overnight, 50 cents.
The rate for using the night flying facilities at the Airport is $1.00 for each
landing and take-off. This charge includes the use of special lighting, such as
floodlights and boundary lights.
Anyone not a regular operator and desiring to operate or carry passengers
for hire from the Airport, will be charged at the same rate as that applied to
base operators.
GENERAL FIELD REGULATIONS:
1. Automobiles must not drive east of the Administration Building.
2. None but licensed aircraft, as defined by Chapter II, Air Commerce
Regulations, will be allowed to operate from the Airport.
3. Automobiles must park in the areas allotted for that purpose.
4. Only licensed pilots will be allowed to navigate or work on any air-
craft.
5. Individuals taking courses in flying must be accompanied by a licensed
pilot.
5a. Only licensed mechanics will be allowed to work on aircraft.
6. Aircraft must be marked in accordance with Chapter II of the Air
Commerce Regulations.
7. Certificates of air worthiness; pilots, mechanics, and students' licenses
must be registered with the Airport Superintendent.
8. The City and County of San Francisco, its agents or employees assume
no liability for damage arising out of any accident to individuals or
aircraft.
9. Any and all damage inflicted on property belonging to the City and
County of San Francisco must be paid for by the individual or party
causing such damage.
10.
Refuse must not be thrown about the Airport.
11. No one will be allowed in the Administration Building except on
business.
12.
Swinging of propellers, except by owners, operators, pilots, mechanics
or Airport employees, is prohibited.
13.
Chocks must be placed under airplane wheels before the motors are
started. A licensed pilot or mechanic must be in the cockpit during
the running of the engine.
14. Photographs must not be taken of any crash or accident without the
Airport Superintendent's permission.
Tips, commissions, or emoluments of any kind to Airport employees
are prohibited.
